contentrichtext.text: {{Redirect|Herminie|the given name|Hermine (disambiguation){{!}}Hermine}} [[File:Herminie Pennsylvania 2011.jpg|thumb|Herminie's business district<br />Sewickley Avenue]] '''Herminie''' is a [[census-designated place]] (CDP) in [[Sewickley Township, Pennsylvania|Sewickley Township]], [[Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania|Westmoreland County]], [[Pennsylvania]], [[United States]]. The population was 856 at the 2000 census. ==History== Herminie was named for Herminie Berwind, whose husband, Charles Berwind, was President of the Ocean Coal Company.<ref name="oldminer">{{cite web|url=http://patheoldminer.rootsweb.ancestry.com/ocean.html |title=Ocean No. 1 Mine (Herminie Mine) |accessdate=2008-06-07 |last=Washlaski |first=Raymond A. |coauthors=Ryan P. Washlaski, Peter E. Starry, Jr. |date=2008-05-14 |work=Virtual Museum of Coal Mining in Western Pennsylvania }}</ref> The first mine at Herminie, known as the "Ocean No. 1 Mine," was opened in 1893 by Berwind-White Coal Company, of which Ocean Coal Company was a subsidiary. Fifty double houses were built for miners, plus five single-family houses for managers on Church Street. By 1900, the mine employed 271 people.<ref name="<ref name="oldminer"/> Herminie was the scene of two major strikes. During the [[Westmoreland County Coal Strike of 1910–1911]], miners were evicted from company-owned houses, which were used to house strikebreakers, predominantly southern Blacks. The strike was unsuccessful from the strikers' perspective. Another strike in 1922 resulted in recognition of the [[United Mine Workers]] union.<ref name="oldminer"/> Ocean No. 1 Mine closed in 1938 due to water problems, although other mines in the nearby area continued operating.<ref name="oldminer"/> ==Geography== Herminie is located at {{coord|40.263150|-79.714675|type:city_region:US|format=dms|display=inline,title}}.{{GR|1}} According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the CDP has a total area of {{convert|0.2|sqmi|km2}}, all of it land. ==Demographics== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 856 people, 368 households, and 231 families residing in the CDP. The [[population density]] was 3,507.7 people per square mile (1,377.1/km<sup>2</sup>). There were 402 housing units at an average density of 1,647.3/sq mi (646.7/km<sup>2</sup>). The racial makeup of the CDP was 97.9 percent [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 0.2 percent [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 0.6 percent [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 0.5 percent [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]], 0.6 percent from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 0.2 percent from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 1.5 percent of the population. There were 368 households out of which 28.5% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 46.2 percent were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 12 percent had a female householder with no husband present, and 37 percent were non-families. Of all the households, 33.4 percent were made up of individuals, and 18.8 percent had someone living alone who was sixty-five years of age or older. The average household size was 2.33 and the average family size was 2.97. In the CDP, the population was spread out with 23.8 percent under the age of eighteen, 6.4 percent from age eighteen to twenty-four, 30.1 percent from twenty-five to forty-four, 20.1 percent from forty-five to sixty-four, and 19.5 percent who were sixty-five years of age or older. The median age was thirty-eight years. For every 100 females, there were 92.4 males. For every 100 females age eighteen and over, there were 86.3 males. The median income for a household in the CDP was $24,258; and the median income for a family was $29,583. Males had a median income of $31,786 versus $15,781 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the CDP was $14,988. About 10.0 percent of families and 17.2 percent of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 15.3 percent of those under age eighteen, and 22.1 percent of those age sixty-five or older. {{Portal|Pittsburgh}}==Notable residents== * [[Sonny Clark]] (1931–1963), jazz pianist * LTC [[Anthony Herbert (US soldier)|Anthony B.
